definition: to draw towards oneself/to gather/to gather up (one's gown, sleeves etc)/to grab (money)/to extort
to hug/to embrace/to hold in one's arms
to hold/to carry (in one's arms)/to hug/to embrace/to surround/to cherish

sentences.english: The lovers kissed and cuddled on the sofa.
sentences.chinese: 在沙發上又是接吻又是摟抱。

sentences.english: There seems to be an intense physical attraction ; he hangs all over her.
sentences.chinese: 他們之間似乎有強烈的身體誘惑力，他緊緊地摟抱她。

sentences.english: Good Loving Do not smooch in the company of others.
sentences.chinese: 得體示愛在大庭廣衆之下，別摟抱親吻個不停。

sentences.english: No amount of huddles – or cuddles – will ever crack the rubber band problem.
sentences.chinese: 多少次的開會或“摟抱”都不會解決橡皮筋問題。

sentences.english: We spooned and fell asleep until noon.
sentences.chinese: 我們摟抱着一直睡到中午。

sentences.english: It is so cuddly that she keeps hugging it all day long.
sentences.chinese: 它是那麼逗人喜歡，她整天摟摟抱抱。

definition: partner for dating/a date (boyfriend or girlfriend)
child bride/girl adopted into a family as future daughter-in-law
to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
to like looking attractive (usually of girls)/aestheticism
lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/nitpicking/overcritical
